item.title: Electromagnetism is a property of spacetime itself, study finds
item.description: Imagine if we could use strong electromagnetic fields to manipulate the local properties of spacetime—this could have important ramifications in terms of science and engineering.

item.title: Who runs the world?
item.description: I am reading the book 'Shantaram' these days, and while there are many great moments in the book, the first two pages of Chapter 17 might have been the most profound two pages I've read all this year. It's a discussion on a topic that we've all probably wondered about at some point in our lives, 'Who runs the world?' I've heard several...

item.title: Cloudflare's Handling of an RCE Vulnerability in cdnjs
item.description: Recently, a RCE vulnerability in the way cdnjs’ backend is automatically keeping web resources up to date has been disclosed. Read about how Cloudflare handled the security incident and what will prevent similar exploits in the future.

item.title: How I built a web development career w/o being fast or smart
item.description: I have a confession to make: I'm not a very good developer. Definitely not a 10x developer – more like a 0.8x. Here's how I make an awesome living despite that.

item.title: Integration Testing with xUnit
item.description: A few years back, I had given up on xUnit in favor of Fixie because of the flexibility that Fixie provides. The xUnit project is highly opinionated, and geared strictly towards unit tests. It's great for that. A broader testing strategy includes much more than just unit tests. With Fixie,
item.author: (Jimmy Bogard)

item.title: Weekly Update 253
